metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37616 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A prototype pollution vulnerability exists in the function copy in dom.jsin the xmldom (published as @xmldom/xmldom) package before 0.8.3 forNode.js via the p variable. NOTE: the vendor states "we are in the processof marking this report as invalid"; however, some third parties takes theposition that "A prototype injection/Prototype pollution is not just whenglobal objects are polluted with recursive merge or deep cloning but alsowhen a target object is polluted."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-xmldom - 0.7.5-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-xmldom package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.5-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
